Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to disclose change in marital status
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant failed to disclose a change in marital status, precluding his wife from being considered a member of the family class
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations s. 117(9)(d)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant applied for permanent residency before marriage, married before landing, and did not inform immigration authorities
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Upheld IAD decision; 'time of that application' includes period until permanent residency is granted
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Failed to disclose marriage during permanent residence application process
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Wife denied family class status due to non-disclosure
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Timing of marriage relative to application and landing
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not applicable – issue of legal interpretation
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Application records, marriage certificate, sponsorship documents
Crimes.Application_Basis: Non-accompanying family member not examined at time of application
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Marriage occurred after application but before landing
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Recognition of wife as family class member
Crimes.Governing_Rule: A foreign national is not a family class member if they were a non-accompanying family member at the time of the sponsor's application and were not examined
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to disclose marital status change
Crimes.Outcome: Appeal dismissed; wife not eligible for family class sponsorship
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Spousal separation due to ineligibility for sponsorship
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant failed to disclose marriage before becoming a permanent resident
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Authorities relied on incomplete application data
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of disclosure prevented examination of spouse
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Application process deemed ongoing until landing
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Omission of material change in circumstances
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration matters
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Undisputed facts regarding timeline of events
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Regulation validly excludes unexamined non-accompanying family members
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: No new evidence introduced; record based on application file
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard applied to IAD interpretation

Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Scope of 'time of application' under immigration regulations
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Spouse excluded from family class due to lack of examination
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Process found to be fair and in accordance with law

Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Factual basis accepted; focus on constitutional interpretation
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to prove Charter infringement
Crimes.Legal_Rule: No s. 7 Charter right to sponsor a spouse automatically
